greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of inequivalent (ordered) solutions to a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 = n^2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: for a from 0 to N do
for b from a to floor(sqrt(N^2-a^2)) do
for c from b to floor(sqrt(N^2-a^2-b^2)) do
if f^2 + 2*f*c <= q and (f + q/f)::even then
if r <= N then R[r]:= R[r]+1 fi;
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_, Nov 18 2001
ext: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 17 2015
